definition: clothes and other items packed for traveling/baggage/luggage

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
travel equipment/travel gear

sentences.english: Rachel has some great ideas for packing and organizing kids stuff for a trip.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔在关于给孩子旅行装包方面有着很伟大的点子。

sentences.english: Even so, many activists say they are packing their bags and heading to Washington.
sentences.chinese: 即便这样，许多倡导者说他们要收拾行装上华盛顿。

sentences.english: Now Lin is helping Jack with the packing.
sentences.chinese: 这会儿小林正帮着杰克收拾行装。

sentences.english: Excuse me while I pack for California.
sentences.chinese: 我要整理行装前往加利福尼亚，不好意思就此打住。

sentences.english: No , i was just pickin ' some stuff up ' cause i ' m moving.
sentences.chinese: 不，我只是去收拾行装，因为我搬了。

sentences.english: If a player came back and collected their stuff, they were going to France.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人回来收拾行装，他就能去法国参加比赛。

sentences.english: Graduates are busy in packing up for their working posts.
sentences.chinese: 毕业生们正忙着整理行装去新的工作岗位。

sentences.english: Jeans, T-shirts and a wind-proof jacket constitute a perfect outfit for ordinary outing.
sentences.chinese: 牛仔，T恤衫和防风夹克是日常行装的完美组合。

sentences.english: I am packing my things up for the long journey.
sentences.chinese: 我在为这次长途旅行整理行装。

sentences.english: I hate all this fussy packing.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢忙乱地整理行装。

sentences.english: Graduates are busy (in) packing up for their working posts.
sentences.chinese: 毕业生们正忙着整理行装去他们新的工作岗位。

sentences.english: I'm leaving in an hour and I haven't packed yet!
sentences.chinese: 我一小时后就要动身，而我的行装还未整理好呢。

sentences.english: He equipped himself for the journey.
sentences.chinese: 他为这次旅行准备了行装。

sentences.english: It was the last straw for her; she packed up and moved north and regained her life.
sentences.chinese: 她忍无可忍，只好整理行装，搬到北部，重新生活。

sentences.english: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother and went to the land of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 于是若瑟整理行装，带著孩子和他的母亲返回以色列。

definition: traveling bag/luggage
settled/accomplished/ready
to set out/to leave
to set out on a journey
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to go on a journey/to leave
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to take leave
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to strike camp
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
backpack/knapsack/rucksack
a person's clothing/outfit/actor's costume
team leader (archaic)/shopkeeper (archaic)
to live an exhausting journey
lit. covered in dust (idiom)/fig. travel-worn
